title: "India-China Ties Have Improved Of Late": S Jaishankar In Parliament
content: India-China ties - "abnormal" since April 2020, when the two militaries clashed in parts of eastern Ladakh, leading to fatalities on both sides for the first time in 45 years - have improved recently, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said.
summary: India-China ties - "abnormal" since April 2020, when the two militaries clashed in parts of eastern Ladakh, leading to fatalities on both sides for the first time in 45 years - have improved recently, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said.

title: What Kash Patel, Trump's Pick As FBI Chief, Plans To Do After Taking Charge
content: Kash Pate, President-elect Donald Trumps nominee to lead the FBI, has pledged to make the so-called "Diddy list" and the infamous Epstein files public after taking office.
summary: Kash Pate, President-elect Donald Trumps nominee to lead the FBI, has pledged to make the so-called "Diddy list" and the infamous Epstein files public after taking office.

title: After Bill Clinton, Trump, Biden In List Of US Presidents Pardoning Relatives
content: US presidents traditionally dole out pardons as they leave office but Joe Biden's "full and unconditional" pardon of his son Hunter is a rare instance involving a family member.
summary: US presidents traditionally dole out pardons as they leave office but Joe Biden's "full and unconditional" pardon of his son Hunter is a rare instance involving a family member.

title: At COP16, Saudi Arabia Bets On Climate Tech To Make Deserts Bloom
content: Saudi Arabia is investing in green innovation to transform its deserts, but accusations of greenwashing highlight the challenge of turning ambitious projects into climate solutions.
summary: Saudi Arabia is investing in green innovation to transform its deserts, but accusations of greenwashing highlight the challenge of turning ambitious projects into climate solutions.

title: "Honour Of My Lifetime": Pat Gelsinger After Stepping Down As Intel CEO
content: Pat Gelsinger has stepped down as the CEO of Intel Corporation effective December 1, just under four years after taking the top job.
summary: Pat Gelsinger has stepped down as the CEO of Intel Corporation effective December 1, just under four years after taking the top job.

title: New Clues Point To Possible Alien Life Beneath Mars' Surface
content: By analyzing data from various Mars missions, the team has identified a subsurface zone, between 4.3 and 8.8 kilometres deep, where conditions could support microbial activity.
summary: By analyzing data from various Mars missions, the team has identified a subsurface zone, between 4.3 and 8.8 kilometres deep, where conditions could support microbial activity.

title: 'Avoid Saffron Robes, Tilak In Public': ISKCON Monk's Bangladesh Advisory
content: ISKCON Kolkata spokesperson Radharamn Das on Tuesday said he has urged its monks and followers from Bangladesh to avoid wearing saffron robes and 'tilak' in public, advising them to practice their faith discreetly.
summary: ISKCON Kolkata spokesperson Radharamn Das on Tuesday said he has urged its monks and followers from Bangladesh to avoid wearing saffron robes and 'tilak' in public, advising them to practice their faith discreetly.

title: Sombrero Galaxy Appears Distinct In New Image From Webb Telescope
content: The Sombrero galaxy, or Messier 104 or M104, is roughly 30 million light-years from the Earth in the Virgo constellation.
summary: The Sombrero galaxy, or Messier 104 or M104, is roughly 30 million light-years from the Earth in the Virgo constellation.

title: "I Was Shattered": Deepfakes Target Women Leaders In Pakistan
content: Pakistani politician Azma Bukhari is haunted by a counterfeit image of herself -- a sexualised deepfake video published to discredit her role as one of the nation's few female leaders.
summary: Pakistani politician Azma Bukhari is haunted by a counterfeit image of herself -- a sexualised deepfake video published to discredit her role as one of the nation's few female leaders.

title: Tripura's Big Crackdown After Dhaka Flags Mission Breach, Delhi Agrees
content: Seven protesters detained after Bangladesh mission breach in Tripura, 3 cops suspended

title: Michelin Chef Pleads Thieves After They Steal 2,500 Pies Worth Rs 26 Lakh
content: The staff had kept the pies overnight in the refrigerated van but found the vehicle vanished in the morning.

title: Bored Chinese Man Creates Fake Arrest Warrant, Offers Rs 3.51 Lakh Reward

title: Trump May Cancel NASA's Giant Moon Rocket: What It Would Mean For Elon Musk
content: Since Donald Trumps recent electoral victory, rumours and speculation have circulated that Nasas giant Moon rocket, the Space Launch System (SLS), could be under threat.

title: Dressing The Church: One Of Rome's Last Clergyman Tailors
content: With a tape measure around his neck and thimble on his finger, Raniero Mancinelli slides a needle into a black cassock with red piping destined for a Catholic cardinal.
summary: With a tape measure around his neck and thimble on his finger, Raniero Mancinelli slides a needle into a black cassock with red piping destined for a Catholic cardinal.

title: Bill Gates Calls India A "Kind Of Laboratory To Try Things", Faces Backlash

title: No Lawyer For Hindu Priest In Bangladesh, Next Bail Hearing After A Month
content: The bail hearing of Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, the Hindu priest arrested and accused of sedition in Bangladesh, has been pushed to next month after no lawyer appeared in court for the hearing on Tuesday.
summary: The bail hearing of Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, the Hindu priest arrested and accused of sedition in Bangladesh, has been pushed to next month after no lawyer appeared in court for the hearing on Tuesday.

title: US Lawmakers Back Covid Chinese Lab Leak Theory After Two-Year Probe
content: US lawmakers concluded a two-year investigation Monday into the Covid-19 outbreak that killed 1.1 million Americans -- backing the theory that the virus likely leaked from a Chinese laboratory.
summary: US lawmakers concluded a two-year investigation Monday into the Covid-19 outbreak that killed 1.1 million Americans -- backing the theory that the virus likely leaked from a Chinese laboratory.

title: Who Is Aliya Fakhri, Nargis Fakhri's Sister Arrested For Killing Ex Boyfriend
content: Aliya Fakhri, sister of actor Nargis Fakhri, was arrested for allegedly murdering her ex-boyfriend and his friend in Queens by setting a two-story garage on fire. The court has remanded her and her next appearance is scheduled for December 9.
summary: Aliya Fakhri, sister of actor Nargis Fakhri, was arrested for allegedly murdering her ex-boyfriend and his friend in Queens by setting a two-story garage on fire. The court has remanded her and her next appearance is scheduled for December 9.
